Name: SMTP too long line
description: Some antivirus scanners dies when they process an email with a too long string without line breaks.
Such a message was sent. If there is an antivirus on your MTA, it might have crashed. Please check its status right now, as it is not possible to do it remotely.
detection_result: Vulnerability was detected according to the Vulnerability Detection Method.
solution: Contact the vendor of the antivirus scanner to get an update.

Name: OpenVAS / Greenbone Vulnerability Manager Default Credentials
description: The remote OpenVAS / Greenbone Vulnerability Manager is installed/congured in a way that it has account(s) with default passwords enabled.
detection_result: It was possible to login using the following credentials (username:password:role): admin:admin:Admin
detection_method: Try to login with default credentials via the OMP/GMP protocol.
Details: OpenVAS / Greenbone Vulnerability Manager Default Credentials
impact: This issue may be exploited by a remote attacker to gain access to sensitive information or modify system conguration.
solution: Change the password of the mentioned account(s).
insight: It was possible to login with default credentials: admin/admin, sadmin/changeme, observer/observer or admin/openvas.
product_detection_result: Method: OpenVAS / Greenbone Vulnerability Manager Detection

Name: SSL/TLS: Certicate Expired
description: The remote server's SSL/TLS certicate has already expired.
detection_result: The certificate of the remote service expired on 2020-08-20 19:18:24.
issued by .: C=DE,L=Osnabrueck,O=OpenVAS Users,OU=Certificate Authority for 218ffb30ff7a
solution: Replace the SSL/TLS certicate by a new one.
insight: This script checks expiry dates of certicates associated with SSL/TLS-enabled services on the target and reports whether any have already expired.

Name: Check if Mailserver answer to VRFY and EXPN requests
description: The Mailserver on this host answers to VRFY and/or EXPN requests.
detection_result: 'VRFY root' produces the following answer: 252 2.0.0 root
detection_method: Details: Check if Mailserver answer to VRFY and EXPN requests
solution: Disable VRFY and/or EXPN on your Mailserver.
For Sendmail add the option 'O PrivacyOptions=goaway'.
It is suggested that, if you really want to publish this type of information, you use a mechanism that legitimate users actually know about, such as Finger or HTTP.
insight: VRFY and EXPN ask the server for information about an address. They are inherently unusable through rewalls, gateways, mail exchangers for part-time hosts, etc.

Name: SSL/TLS: Certicate Expired
description: The remote server's SSL/TLS certicate has already expired.
detection_result: The certificate of the remote service expired on 2020-08-20 19:18:24.
issued by .: C=DE,L=Osnabrueck,O=OpenVAS Users,OU=Certificate Authority for 218ffb30ff7a
solution: Replace the SSL/TLS certicate by a new one.
insight: This script checks expiry dates of certicates associated with SSL/TLS-enabled services on the target and reports whether any have already expired.

Name: CGI Scanning Consolidation
description: The script consolidates various information for CGI scanning.
This information is based on the following scripts / settings:
- HTTP-Version Detection (OID: 1.3.6.1.4.1.25623.1.0.100034)
- Web mirroring / webmirror.nasl (OID: 1.3.6.1.4.1.25623.1.0.10662)
- Directory Scanner / DDI_Directory_Scanner.nasl (OID: 1.3.6.1.4.1.25623.1.0.11032)
- The congured 'cgi_path' within the 'Scanner Preferences' of the scan cong in use

- The congured 'Enable CGI scanning', 'Enable generic web application scanning' and 'Add historic /scripts and /cgi-bin to directories for CGI scanning' within the 'Global variable settings' of the scan cong in use
If you think any of this information is wrong please report it to the referenced community portal.
detection_result: The Hostname/IP "localhost" was used to access the remote host.
Generic web application scanning is disabled for this host via the "Enable generic web application scanning" option within the "Global variable settings" of the scan config in use.
Requests to this service are done via HTTP/1.1.
This service seems to be NOT able to host PHP scripts.
This service seems to be NOT able to host ASP scripts.
The User-Agent "Mozilla/5.0 [en] (X11, U; OpenVAS-VT 9.0.3)" was used to access the remote host.

Historic /scripts and /cgi-bin are not added to the directories used for CGI scanning. You can enable this again with the "Add historic /scripts and /cgi-bin to directories for CGI scanning" option within the "Global variable settings" of the scan config in use.
The following directories were used for CGI scanning:
While this is not, in and of itself, a bug, you should manually inspect these directories to ensure that they are in compliance with company security standards

The following directories were excluded from CGI scanning because the "Regex pattern to exclude directories from CGI scanning" setting of the NVT "Global variable settings" (OID: 1.3.6.1.4.1.25623.1.0.12288) for this scan was: "/(index\.php|image|img|css|js$|js/|javascript|style|theme|icon|jquery|graphic|grafik|picture|bilder|thumbnail|media/|skins?/)")

Name: Greenbone Security Assistant (GSA) Detection
description: The script sends a connection request to the server and attempts to determine if it is a GSA from the reply.

Name: HTTP Security Headers Detection
description: All known security headers are being checked on the host. On completion a report will hand back whether a specic security header has been implemented (including its value) or is missing on the target.

Name: Services
description: This routine attempts to guess which service is running on the remote ports. For instance, it searches for a web server which could listen on another port than 80 or 443 and makes this information available for other check routines.
detection_result: A TLScustom server answered on this port
A web server is running on this port through SSL
An SMTP server is running on this port
Here is its banner : 220 9c89ef55d1a6.localdomain ESMTP Postfix

Name: SSL/TLS: Collect and Report Certicate Details
description: This script collects and reports the details of all SSL/TLS certicates. This data will be used by other tests to verify server certicates.
detection_result: The following certificate details of the remote service were collected.
issued by .: C=DE,L=Osnabrueck,O=OpenVAS Users,OU=Certificate Authority for 218ffb30ff7a
log_method: Details: SSL/TLS: Collect and Report Certificate Details

Name: SSL/TLS: HTTP Public Key Pinning (HPKP) Missing
description: The remote web server is not enforcing HPKP.
detection_result: The remote web server is not enforcing HPKP.
solution: Enable HPKP or add / congure the required directives correctly following the guides linked in the references.
log_method: Details: SSL/TLS: HTTP Public Key Pinning (HPKP) Missing

Name: SSL/TLS: HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) Missing
description: The remote web server is not enforcing HSTS.
detection_result: The remote web server is not enforcing HSTS.
solution: Enable HSTS or add / congure the required directives correctly following the guides linked in the references.
log_method: Details: SSL/TLS: HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) Missing

Name: SSL/TLS: Perfect Forward Secrecy Cipher Suites Missing
description: The remote service is missing support for SSL/TLS cipher suites supporting Perfect Forward Secrecy.
detection_result: The remote service does not support perfect forward secrecy cipher suites.
log_method: Details: SSL/TLS: Perfect Forward Secrecy Cipher Suites Missing

description: This routine reports all Medium SSL/TLS cipher suites accepted by a service.
detection_result: 'Medium' cipher suites accepted by this service via the TLSv1.1 protocol:
'Medium' cipher suites accepted by this service via the TLSv1.2 protocol:

Name: SSL/TLS: Report Supported Cipher Suites
description: This routine reports all SSL/TLS cipher suites accepted by a service. As the NVT 'SSL/TLS: Check Supported Cipher Suites' (OID: 1.3.6.1.4.1.25623.1.0.900234) might run into a timeout the actual reporting of all accepted cipher suites takes place in this NVT instead. The script preference 'Report timeout' allows you to congure if such an timeout is reported.
detection_result: No 'Strong' cipher suites accepted by this service via the TLSv1.1 protocol.
'Medium' cipher suites accepted by this service via the TLSv1.1 protocol:
No 'Weak' cipher suites accepted by this service via the TLSv1.1 protocol.
No 'Null' cipher suites accepted by this service via the TLSv1.1 protocol.
No 'Anonymous' cipher suites accepted by this service via the TLSv1.1 protocol.
No 'Strong' cipher suites accepted by this service via the TLSv1.2 protocol.
'Medium' cipher suites accepted by this service via the TLSv1.2 protocol:
No 'Weak' cipher suites accepted by this service via the TLSv1.2 protocol.
No 'Null' cipher suites accepted by this service via the TLSv1.2 protocol.
No 'Anonymous' cipher suites accepted by this service via the TLSv1.2 protocol.
log_method: Details: SSL/TLS: Report Supported Cipher Suites

Name: wapiti (NASL wrapper)
description: This plugin uses wapiti to nd web security issues. Make sure to have wapiti 2.x as wapiti 1.x is not supported. See the preferences section for wapiti options. Note that the scanner is using limited set of wapiti options. Therefore, for more complete web assessment, you should use standalone wapiti tool for deeper/customized checks. Note: The plugin needs the 'wapiti' binary found within the PATH of the user running the scanner and needs to be executable for this user. The existence of this binary is checked and reported separately within 'Availability of scanner helper tools' (OID: 1.3.6.1.4.1.25623.1.0.810000).
detection_result: The wapiti report filename is empty. That could mean that a wrong version of wapiti is used or tmp dir is not accessible. Make sure to have wapiti 2.x as wapiti 1.x is not supported. In short: Check the installation of wapiti and the scanner.

Name: Postx SMTP Server Detection
description: The script checks the SMTP server banner for the presence of Postx.

Name: SMTP antivirus scanner DoS
description: This script sends the 42.zip recursive archive to the mail server. If there is an antivirus lter, it may start eating huge amounts of CPU or memory.
detection_result: For some reason, we could not send the 42.zip file to this MTA.

Name: SMTP Missing Support For STARTTLS
description: The remote SMTP server does not support the 'STARTTLS' command.
detection_result: The remote SMTP server does not support the 'STARTTLS' command.
log_method: Details: SMTP Missing Support For STARTTLS

Name: SMTP Server type and version
description: This detects the SMTP Server's type and version by connecting to the server and processing the buer received.
detection_result: The remote SMTP server is announcing the following available ESMTP commands (EHLO response) via an unencrypted connection: 8BITMIME, DSN, ENHANCEDSTATUSCODES, ETRN, PIPELINING, SIZE 10240000, VRFY
log_method: Details: SMTP Server type and version
